definition: and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities

sentences.english: I'm just surviving, that's why I want you to know.
sentences.chinese: 我是在苟且偷生，這就是爲什麼我想讓你知道。

sentences.english: It's better to die with hornor than to live in infamy .
sentences.chinese: 與其苟且偷生不如光榮而死。

sentences.english: Run, and you'll live… at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: Run, and you will live at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: But you cannot maintain that survival mentality forever.
sentences.chinese: 不過，你不能永遠保持這種苟且求生的心態。

sentences.english: Everyone in the company is supposed to work hard, not to lie on a bed of roses.
sentences.chinese: 公司裏的每個人都應努力工作，不得苟且偷安。

sentences.english: Run, and you'll live at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: I prefer the challenge of life to the guaranteed existence;
sentences.chinese: 我寧願接受生活的挑戰而不願苟且偷安。

sentences.english: Unlike many men who lived long after, Henry Young did not die in vain.
sentences.chinese: 與許多苟且偷生的人不同，亨利揚不要白白地死去。

sentences.english: Lord, let me never, never, outlive my love for thee.
sentences.chinese: 主，我莫苟且偷生，如若對你愛減退。

sentences.english: It saved one's skin; but it did not help the growth of a complex economy.
sentences.chinese: 這樣苟且偷生，但對發展綜合經濟卻無任何幫助。

sentences.english: I had rather die than live in dishonor.
sentences.chinese: 我寧可死也不願苟且偷生。

sentences.english: They purchase life at the expense of honour.
Is the inability live an assertion of life?
sentences.chinese: 難道苟且的活着是一種生命的維護嗎？

definition: to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
not having any special skill/without any qualifications
